description: User can register with email and password, and receive JWT token for authentication
steps: Step 1: Send POST request to /api/auth/register with email and password
Step 2: Verify response contains JWT access token and refresh token
Step 3: Verify token can be used in Authorization header for subsequent requests
Step 4: Attempt to register with same email and verify rejection

description: User can login with email and password, receiving a valid JWT token
steps: Step 1: Send POST request to /api/auth/login with registered email and password
Step 2: Verify response contains valid JWT access token
Step 3: Use token to access protected endpoints successfully
Step 4: Test login with incorrect password returns 401 error

description: User can create an expense with amount, category, date, and optional description
steps: Step 1: Authenticate user and get JWT token
Step 2: Send POST request to /api/expenses with expense data (amount, category, date, description)
Step 3: Verify expense is created with correct data and unique ID
Step 4: Attempt to create expense with missing required field and verify 400 error
Step 5: Attempt to create expense with invalid amount (negative) and verify rejection

description: User can retrieve all expenses with filtering by date range and category
steps: Step 1: Create multiple expenses with different categories and dates
Step 2: Send GET request to /api/expenses to retrieve all expenses
Step 3: Filter expenses by date range using query parameters
Step 4: Filter expenses by category using query parameters
Step 5: Apply both filters simultaneously and verify correct results

description: User can update an existing expense with new values
steps: Step 1: Create an expense and get its ID
Step 2: Send PUT request to /api/expenses/{id} with updated data
Step 3: Verify expense is updated with new amount, category, date, or description
Step 4: Attempt to update non-existent expense and verify 404 error
Step 5: Attempt to update expense with invalid data and verify 400 error

description: User can delete an expense by ID
steps: Step 1: Create an expense and retrieve its ID
Step 2: Send DELETE request to /api/expenses/{id}
Step 3: Verify expense is deleted and no longer retrievable
Step 4: Attempt to delete non-existent expense and verify 404 error
Step 5: Verify only the authenticated user can delete their own expenses

description: User can view a list of predefined expense categories
steps: Step 1: Send GET request to /api/categories
Step 2: Verify response includes categories like Food, Transport, Entertainment, Utilities, Health, Shopping, Other
Step 3: Create expense and verify category must be from predefined list
Step 4: Attempt to create expense with custom category and verify rejection

description: Backend performs comprehensive input validation on all expense data
steps: Step 1: Test amount validation (negative, zero, non-numeric, too large)
Step 2: Test date validation (invalid format, future dates)
Step 3: Test category validation (invalid category, null, empty string)
Step 4: Test description validation (max length, special characters)
Step 5: Verify all validation errors return 400 status with descriptive messages

description: Frontend displays dashboard with summary of total spending and monthly overview
steps: Step 1: Login to the application
Step 2: Navigate to dashboard
Step 3: Verify total spending amount is displayed prominently
Step 4: Verify current month's spending is shown
Step 5: Verify responsive layout works on mobile, tablet, and desktop

description: Frontend displays interactive pie/donut chart showing spending breakdown by category
steps: Step 1: Create expenses across multiple categories
Step 2: Navigate to dashboard or analytics page
Step 3: Verify pie chart displays all categories with color coding
Step 4: Verify chart shows percentage or amount for each category
Step 5: Test interactivity - hovering/clicking shows category details

description: Frontend displays line/bar chart showing spending trends over months
steps: Step 1: Create expenses across multiple months
Step 2: Navigate to analytics or trends page
Step 3: Verify chart displays monthly spending data
Step 4: Verify chart is responsive and readable
Step 5: Test chart updates when new expenses are added

description: User can export all expenses to CSV file with proper formatting
steps: Step 1: Create multiple expenses with different categories and amounts
Step 2: Send GET request to /api/expenses/export/csv
Step 3: Verify CSV file is returned with correct headers (Date, Category, Amount, Description)
Step 4: Verify all expenses are included in CSV with correct formatting
Step 5: Verify CSV can be opened in spreadsheet application without errors

description: User can set a monthly budget for each category with alerts when exceeded
steps: Step 1: Send POST request to /api/budgets with category and monthly limit
Step 2: Verify budget is saved and retrievable
Step 3: Create expense that exceeds budget for that category
Step 4: Verify alert is triggered (via API response or notification)
Step 5: Test updating and deleting budgets

description: Frontend displays budget alerts when spending exceeds category limits
steps: Step 1: Set budget for a category
Step 2: Create expenses that exceed the budget
Step 3: Verify alert/warning is displayed on dashboard or expense page
Step 4: Verify alert includes budget amount, current spending, and overage amount
Step 5: Verify alerts are color-coded (yellow for warning, red for over budget)

description: User can create recurring expenses that repeat at specified intervals
steps: Step 1: Send POST request to /api/recurring-expenses with amount, category, frequency (daily/weekly/monthly/yearly)
Step 2: Verify recurring expense is saved with ID
Step 3: Retrieve recurring expenses and verify they are returned
Step 4: Update recurring expense with new amount or frequency
Step 5: Delete recurring expense and verify it's removed

description: Recurring expenses are automatically generated as actual expenses on their schedule
steps: Step 1: Create recurring expense with daily frequency for $10
Step 2: Check expense list for current date - verify daily expense exists
Step 3: Verify recurring expenses are created automatically (simulate with background job or scheduled task)
Step 4: Create recurring monthly expense and verify it's generated monthly
Step 5: Pause/deactivate recurring expense and verify generation stops

description: User can upload receipt images and attach them to expenses
steps: Step 1: Create an expense
Step 2: Upload image file (PNG/JPG) to /api/expenses/{id}/receipt
Step 3: Verify image is stored and accessible
Step 4: Verify receipt image URL is returned and can be retrieved
Step 5: Test uploading invalid file type and verify rejection

description: Frontend allows users to upload and view receipt images in expense details
steps: Step 1: Navigate to expense detail page
Step 2: Click to upload receipt image
Step 3: Select image file and verify upload confirmation
Step 4: Verify receipt image is displayed in expense details
Step 5: Verify image displays correctly on mobile and desktop

description: Backend implements proper error handling with descriptive error messages
steps: Step 1: Test unauthorized access (missing or invalid token)
Step 2: Test 404 errors (non-existent resources)
Step 3: Test 400 errors (invalid input data)
Step 4: Test 500 errors (server errors) return appropriate response
Step 5: Verify all error responses include descriptive message and error code

description: Backend includes pytest unit tests with >80% coverage for all endpoints
steps: Step 1: Run pytest on backend codebase
Step 2: Verify all authentication endpoints are tested
Step 3: Verify all CRUD endpoints are tested with success and failure cases
Step 4: Verify validation and error handling are tested
Step 5: Verify test coverage report shows >80% coverage

description: Application can be deployed and run using Docker Compose
steps: Step 1: Verify docker-compose.yml exists with FastAPI backend service
Step 2: Verify docker-compose.yml includes React frontend service
Step 3: Verify docker-compose.yml includes SQLite database or volume
Step 4: Run 'docker-compose up' and verify all services start successfully
Step 5: Verify frontend and backend are accessible on configured ports

description: Frontend implements clean, modern UI with consistent styling and branding
steps: Step 1: Navigate through all pages of the application
Step 2: Verify consistent color scheme, typography, and spacing throughout
Step 3: Verify all buttons, inputs, and interactive elements have clear states (hover, active, disabled)
Step 4: Verify navigation is intuitive with clear menus or navigation bar
Step 5: Verify loading states and transitions are smooth

description: User can view account settings and update profile information
steps: Step 1: Navigate to account settings page
Step 2: Verify current email is displayed
Step 3: Update profile name/email and verify changes are saved
Step 4: Change password and verify new password works on next login
Step 5: Test attempting to change email to already registered email and verify rejection

description: User can logout and session is properly terminated
steps: Step 1: Login to application
Step 2: Click logout button or access logout endpoint
Step 3: Verify token is invalidated/revoked
Step 4: Attempt to use old token and verify 401 Unauthorized error
Step 5: Verify user is redirected to login page
